subject: Re: Pluggable Selector considered harmful? (Re: [junit] Re: Observations from a production use of JUnit4)
msgSnippet: ... You d think that would be a big issue, but no--even well-known TDD practitioners pooh-pooh it. -- J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.info Your
messageBody:
Daryl Richter wrote:

> > I noticed that the author points out the danger of using Pluggable
> > Selector and reflection in general.
> >
> > What's up with that? Why do so many people find reflection so
> > dangerous?
>
> They don't have good Unit Tests?

You'd think that would be a big issue, but no--even well-known TDD
practitioners pooh-pooh it.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.info
Your guide to software craftsmanship
JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
2005 Gordon Pask Award for contribution Agile Software Practice
